data.title: UT Maps, Demographics and Zip Codes List - MapOfZipCodes
data.meta_description: Explore comprehensive data about Utah (UT) on our page. Dive into detailed zip codes, counties, maps, and other important data about Utah. Whether you're relocating, planning a trip, or researching, find the accurate information you need about Utah here.
data.text:
Home

States

Utah

Utah Zip Code Maps | UT Maps, Demographics and Zip Codes List

Quick Page Links

* Figures are taken between July 2021 and July 2022.

Utah Mapping Products

Population Figures for Utah

Utah Population Between 2010 and 2019

The line chart presents the population in Utah between 2010 and 2022. Back in 2010 there were 2,763,885 people living in the state of Utah. Since then the population has decreased to 3,205,958 people.

Population Change Between 2010 and 2022

The line chart presents the population change in Alabama between 2010 and 2018. The population in Utah has changed by an average of 44,135 residents in the 8 years this chart shows.

Births and Deaths Chart

This chart shows the births and deaths for Utah between 2010 and 2018. We also show the latest 2022 data for this state.

Real Estate Figures

Households in Utah

Utah has approximately 1,101,499 as of the last US census in 2021. Below will find the figures for households, types of households, family types and more.

Most buildings are 2 Unit Structures in Utah. You can see on the graph below that most buildings are occupied by Owners, with a 70/30 split.

Property Value in Utah

Properties in Utah have an average price of around $495,411. Most properties in this state are valued around $300,000 to $399,999 with 176,490 houses residing in this category.

Financial and Employment Figures for Utah

Employment Status for Population Over 16

Utah has an employment rate of 97%. A total of 1,653,768 are currently employed in this state.

How do Workers in Utah Commute to Work?

You will see in the data below that the most popular method to commute in Utah is by Car, Truck or Van Alone. A total of 1,083,829 people commute using this method.

Only 21,749 commute by Public Transport in Utah.

Occupation for Utah Workers

Most workers in Utah work in the Management, Business, Sciences and Arts sector. A total of 697,597 reported working in this sector during the last census.

The least popular sector for workers in Utah is Natural Resources, Construction and Maintenance with just 143,180 people working there.

Most Popular Employment Industries

Education, Health Care and Social Care is the most popular industry for people in Utah. 697,597 people work in the Education, Health Care and Social Care industry.

Income and Benefits Over the Past Year

Utah has a median household income of $79,449 for the past 12 months. Utah has a per capita income of $35,220 and median earnings are $37,325 for workers.

The mean retirement income is $30,361. A mean income of $5,065 is associated with public assistance in this state.

Salary Class, Health Insurance and Poverty Levels

You can see the three pie charts below showing the salary, health insurance and poverty statistics for Utah.

Most people in this state earn their money through Private Wage and Salary. 1,316,671 people in Utah earn their money this way. On the other end, 2,287 people are in the Unpaid Family category

0.91% of people have health insurance in this state. Unfortunately, 0.09% of people don't have any coverage in Utah.

Education and Learning

Educational Attainment Level

As you can see from the column chart below; people in the age group of 45 to 64 with a High School Diploma are most likely to have a high-school diploma in the state of Utah. Those most likely to have a batchelors degree are in the 45 to 64 with a Batchelors age group.

There are 68 colleges and universities in Utah. Below you will find the full list for this state. Please feel free to download this data as a CSV or Excel file. Please get in touch if you need any other data or help.

In Utah there are a total of 70. In the table below you will see every hospital and medical facility in this state. You can download the data to see all the information we have on each hospital.

There are a total of 189 police and law enforcement locations in Utah.

There are a total of 356 in Utah 5 digit zip codes. You can use the list below to check which zip codes are in this state. Alternatively you can download the full list as an Excel file.

As you can see in the table below, there are 29 counties in the state of Utah

Utah has a total of 29 cities. You use the table or download link below to check which cities reside within the state.

Utah has a total of 3 area codes that cover the 356 full zip codes.

Products for UT - Utah Zip Codes

Frequently Asked Questions about Utah

How many zip codes are there in Utah

There are a total of 356 in Utah 5 digit zip codes in the state of Utah.

What is the zip code for Utah?

The first zip code for Utah is 8. The first number of a zip code refers to a specific region of the united state. The first number often covers more than one state.

What is the zip code for the University of Utah

The zip code for the University of Utah in Salt Lake City is 84112. This zip code covers the standard addresses associated with the university. However, for more specific locations within the university, there are different ZIP+4 codes. For instance, the address range from 1 to 99 at the university can have ZIP+4 codes like 84112-1107 or 84112-1102, depending on the exact house number.
